questions.question: What type of rock is obsidian?
What elements is obsidian rich in?
questions.correct_answer: Silicon, oxygen, aluminium, sodium, and potassium
options: Silicon, oxygen, aluminium, sodium, and potassium

questions.question: Why does obsidian form as a natural glass instead of mineral crystals?
questions.correct_answer: Because its high viscosity prevents atom diffusion and it cools rapidly
options: Because its high viscosity prevents atom diffusion and it cools rapidly
Because it forms deep underground over millions of years
Because it contains large amounts of water
Because it undergoes repeated heating and cooling cycles
